title: New York City Faces Its Second Big Storm in Weeks
summary: The storm in late January was bad enough. This one is bringing true blizzard conditions, and the city has stepped up its response.

title: Trump Considers Targeted Strike Against Iran, Followed by Larger Attack
summary: The top negotiators plan to meet in Geneva on Thursday for last-ditch talks, debating a new proposal that could create an off-ramp as two carrier groups massed within striking distance of Iran.

title: Iran Could Direct Proxies to Attack U.S. Targets Abroad, Officials Warn
summary: Security officials are monitoring increasingly worrisome signs as President Trump considers another military campaign against Iran.

title: Inside Iran’s Preparations for War and Plans for Survival
summary: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has entrusted Ali Larijani, the top national security official, to ensure the Islamic Republic endures any military attacks and targeted killings.

title: Armed Man Is Fatally Shot at Mar-a-Lago, Secret Service Says
summary: The local sheriff identified the man as a 21-year-old resident of Cameron, N.C. The president was not at his resort in Florida and has not commented on the shooting.

title: Armed Man Shot Dead at Mar-a-Lago by Trump’s Secret Service Was a 21-Year-Old From N.C.
summary: The 21-year-old man, from North Carolina, was killed by law enforcement officers after he entered secure perimeter of Mar-a-Lago.

title: Here Are the Rare Instances of Fatal Shootings by the Secret Service
summary: Sunday’s shooting of an armed man at President Trump’s Florida club is one of only a handful of fatal encounters that the agency has had in its 160-year history.

title: Mexican Forces Kill ‘El Mencho,’ Nation’s Most-Wanted Cartel Boss
summary: “El Mencho” was the longtime head of one of the nation’s most powerful cartels. Armed groups set fire to cars and buildings across Mexico in the wake of his death.

title: What to Know About the Killing of ‘El Mencho’
summary: The Mexican government has killed Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, the longtime leader of one of Mexico’s most powerful gangs, the Jalisco New Generation Cartel.

title: Trump Aides Project Confidence on Tariffs After Court Loss
summary: Administration officials maintain that they can replicate the sky-high duties recently invalidated by the Supreme Court.

title: When Faced With Claims of Racism, Trump Points to His Black Friends
summary: President Trump has often invoked his unnamed Black friends, or name-checked celebrities and athletes, when asked to discuss anything related to Black voters.

title: F.B.I. Director Celebrates Olympic Hockey Victory on Day of Mar-a-Lago Shooting
summary: Kash Patel’s trip to Italy came at a fraught and frenetic time for the bureau and Mr. Patel, who has shown little willingness to curb his jet-setting.

title: Anti-Trump Republicans Face Divisions and an Uncertain Future
summary: Divisions over what and who should come next were evident as G.O.P. critics of the president, weakened in their party, gathered at a summit near Washington.

title: How A.I. Money Is Flooding Into the Midterm Elections
summary: A.I. companies, along with allied groups and executives, spent at least $83 million on federal elections last year, and huge amounts are set to arrive this year.

title: Inside the Big Tech Lobbying Machine Aiming to Halt Social Media Bans
summary: Tech giants, including Meta and Alphabet, are spending lavishly on splashy billboard ads, courting on-the-fence politicians and bulking up their ranks of lobbyists.

title: 2026 BAFTAs Winners: ‘One Battle After Another’ Wins Best Film, Besting ‘Sinners’
summary: Paul Thomas Anderson’s comedy drama won six awards at the British equivalent of the Oscars. The best actor choice, however, was a surprise.

title: 12 Unforgettable Looks at the BAFTAs: Kate Middleton, Prince William and More
summary: Swishy suits, mermaid skirts, skunk feet and more.

title: Fat Signing Bonuses, and Concierge Service, for Family Doctors
summary: In a country where a quarter of the population lacks a family doctor, Canadian communities compete in a zero-sum battle to recruit family doctors.

title: Tour Montparnasse is One of Paris’s Uglier Landmarks. It’s Getting a Makeover.
summary: The Tour Montparnasse is one of Paris’s least-loved landmarks. After half a century, it’s finally being remodeled.

title: Willie Colón Played Up the Bad Guy With Purpose
summary: By styling himself after mobsters and blaxploitation characters early in his career, Mr. Colón, the legend of salsa music who died on Saturday, crafted an everlasting image.

title: No, Trump Isn’t Good for Putin
summary: Russian hopes for respect have been dashed.

title: Historians Confirm: Tomorrow Won’t Be Better Than Today
summary: The human capacity for hope is an essential quality. But hope can also turn into delusion.

title: Susan Sheehan, Pulitzer-Winning Chronicler of Lives on the Margins, Dies at 88
summary: As a journalist and author, she wrote meticulous portraits of people for The New Yorker. Her book “Is There No Place on Earth for Me?” won the Pulitzer Prize.

title: At Least 15 Have Died on Tahoe-Area Slopes This Year
summary: Three more skiers have died in the Lake Tahoe area since the deadliest avalanche in modern California history on Tuesday killed nine.

title: Hunter College to Review Professor’s ‘Abhorrent’ Remarks at Meeting
summary: A student objected to the potential closure of her New York City middle school. The professor, speaking on a hot mic, said, “They’re too dumb to know they’re in a bad school.” The comment was assailed as racist.

title: Russia Attacks Ukraine Ahead of Invasion’s 4th Anniversary
summary: At least one man was killed in Kyiv as Moscow launched a wave of drones and missiles, days after the latest round of U.S.-mediated talks to end the war.
